title: yamato-no-kami_yasusada
body:
A [[Touken Ranbu]] character. Official art by [[kumita_(sumica)|Kumita]]. Voiced by [[Ichiki Mitsuhiro]].

Both he and [[Kashuu Kiyomitsu]] are personifications of swords owned by [[Okita Souji]]. Unlike Kiyomitsu, who resents Okita for abandoning him, Yasusada is very fond of Okita and hasn't gotten over his former master's death, to the point of dressing and occasionally acting like him. 

He has [[black hair]] worn in a [[high ponytail]], [[blue eyes]], and a [[mole under eye|mole under his left eye]]. His standard outfit is a [[white scarf]], a [[Shinsengumi]] [[haori]], [[black gloves|black]] "[[bridal gauntlets|bridal gauntlet]]"-type gloves, a dark blue [[hakama]], black [[tabi]] and [[zouri]] with blue straps.

Normally, he has a carefree personality with his comrades, but is ruthless and sadistic in battles. Of course, artists tend to portray him as someone who's completely obsessed with Okita (to the point of being dismissive with the Saniwa) and who gets violent for no reason. Either that, or he's presented as a foil to Kiyomitsu.

There is also [[yamato-no-kami yasusada (ootachi)|another sword called Yamato-no-Kami Yasusada]], which is not currently a character in Touken Ranbu.

title: monpe
body:
A type of women's work [[pants]] from Japan. They are also considered to be a type of [[hakama pants]]. 
The waist is loose to allow the hem of a jacket or other outerwear to be tucked inside, and the ankle cuffs are tightened with strings for ease of movement. 
While they were originally used for agricultural labor in the Tohoku region, during the [[World War II]], the Ministry of Welfare encouraged all women in Japan to wear them, and as the state of the war worsened, their wearing was substantively enforced and made mandatory for fire fighting work during air raids. 

On pixiv, this tag is often used for [[pants]] of [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] and [[Kazami Yuuka (PC-98)]]. 
[quote]If you try searching this tag on pixiv, you will find chaotic mixture of [[war]]-related artworks and [[Touhou]] illustrations. 
-- from pixiv encyclopedia 
[/quote] 

h4.See also 

* "Wikipedia article(JP)":http://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E3%82%82%E3%82%93%E3%81%BA

He was supposedly killed by [[Rugal Bernstein|Rugal]] before [[The King of Fighters '94]] but [[Vice (kof)|]] eventually brainwashed him in the next year's tournament ([[The King of Fighters '95]]).

title: mask_panties
body:
This tag describes the situation where a [[mouth mask]] (such as a [[surgical mask]]) is [[mask_on_crotch|worn over the crotch]] as a substitute for [[panties]].  This is shown either by stretching the ear loops of the [[mask]] to use as leg holes (see post #2582922), or more commonly by tying, interlocking, or otherwise binding multiple masks together to be worn as a larger outfit often incorporating a [[mask bikini]] (see post #4048975, post #4329843). Ironically, the character involved may or may not additionally being wearing a mask properly over their face. This theme developed in response to the [[coronavirus pandemic]] of 2020 where mask usage was brought into stark focus.

For the converse of this tag, where [[panties]] are being worn as a [[mask]], use the tag [[panty mask]].

title: gyeongsang_korean_text
body:
Korean dialect spoken in the Gyeongsang region.

This dialect is characterized by merging of [i]ae[/i] and [i]e[/i], as well as [i]eu[/i] and [i]eo[/i], plus dropping of [i]w[/i] and [i]y[/i] (/j/) after consonants. Southern Gyeongsang also lacks the "tense" fortis consonant [i]ss[/i] of Standard Korean; speakers will instead substitute it with a "lax" [i]s[/i].

Southern Gyeongsang (especially the Busan variant) is frequently used in translations and fanworks to adapt Japanese [[Kansaiben]] (analogous to use of Southern American English in English translations and fanworks). Japanese characters who speak Kansai dialect are frequently depicted speaking Busan dialect in Korean translations and fancomics.

h4. See also
* [[Korean text]]
* [[Kansaiben]]

title: asui_tsuyu
body:
Character from [[Boku no Hero Academia]].

A student in Class 1-A. Her quirk is having the [[frog girl|abilities of a frog]]. She has circular black eyes with three prominent eyelashes at the bottom of each one and long black hair [[low-tied long hair|tied at the bottom]], creating [[hair rings]]. Her hero costume consists of goggles ([[goggles on head|worn on her head]] most of the time), brown gloves, and a primary green and black bodysuit with webbed feet and a belt. She has a [[long tongue]] akin to a frog.

She is very straight-forward and blunt whenever she has something to say and occasionally every now and then in her dialogue lets out ribbits ([i]kero[/i] in Japanese). She is very adamant about being called by her first name, Tsuyu, and immediately corrects anybody who calls her by her last name, Asui. A majority of the time she has a "[[:>]]" expression on her face no matter what mood she is in, only going away when she opens her mouth.

She is the older sister of [[Asui Samidare]] and [[Asui Satsuki|Satsuki]].

Like most [[Boku no Hero Academia]] characters her name is a play on her quirk: 蛙 ([i]frog[/i]), 梅雨 ([i]rainy season[/i]).

She is often tagged on Pixiv with ”"Keroine":[http://www.pixiv.net/search.php?s_mode=s_tag_full&word=%E3%82%B1%E3%83%AD%E3%82%A4%E3%83%B3]”, a pun on "heroine" and "kero".

title: non-repeating_animation
body:
An [[animated]] GIF or PNG that stops at the end of the animation instead of looping forever.

Although most animated images loop forever, this is not required. The GIF and PNG file formats allow for animations that loop only once, or that loop for a fixed number of times.

title: peeling
body:
Can imply one of two things:

1. Using a [[peeler]] or [[knife]] to remove the exterior inedible skin from a tuber vegetable such as a [[carrot]] or [[potato]]; using a similar tool to remove the exterior skin of an [[apple]] in a rotating motion; or using bare hands to remove the inedible rind of an [[orange (fruit)|]].
2. Slowing removing clothing that has been adhered to a character, such as [[pasties]].

title: headdress
body:
[i]"An ornamental covering or band for the head, especially one worn on ceremonial occasions."[/i]
[tn](— Oxford Languages dictionary.)[/tn]

Use this tag for ornamental headdresses, such as the [[Native American headdress]]. Most headgear that can be described as "[[hairband|'headband']] but with lots of rigid(ish) decorations attached" or "hat/bonnet but truncated to only the middle 'band' part" are generally headdresses.

This tag can also be used as a fallback tag for ornamental headgear in general, but try to avoid using this tag for [[hat]]s, [[helmet]]s, [[hair ornament]]s, [[fake animal ears]] and simple [[ribbon]]s.

h4. See also
* [[maid headdress]]
* [[lolita hairband]]
** Sometimes called a "heddo-doresu" or "hedore" in Japanese. This should not be confused with "headdress" in English.
** Some of the more ornate examples may qualify as headdresses though.

title: perfect_cherry_blossom
body:
東方妖々夢 ("Touhou Youyoumu") ~ Perfect Cherry Blossom
("Bewitching Eastern Dream")

Seventh game of the [[Touhou]] series and second of the Windows generation.

A near-endless winter drove [[Hakurei Reimu]], [[Kirisame Marisa]] and [[Izayoi Sakuya]] to investigate on the matter, learning that a near-eternal spring was also occurring in the Netherworld - one made under the wishes of its "[[saigyouji_yuyuko|princess]]", and which leads all the way to an [[yakumo_yukari|extremely powerful youkai]].

Preceded by [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and followed by [[Immaterial and Missing Power]].

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Hakurei Reimu]]
* [[Kirisame Marisa]]
* [[Izayoi Sakuya]] (first time as a playable character)

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1 Midboss: [[Cirno]] (reappearance)
* Stage 1 Boss: [[Letty Whiterock]]
* Stage 2 Midboss/Boss: [[Chen]]
* Stage 3 Midboss/Boss: [[Alice Margatroid]] (PC-98 alumna)
* Stage 4 Midboss: [[Lily White]]
* Stage 4 Bosses: [[lunasa_prismriver|Lunasa]], [[merlin_prismriver|Merlin]] and [[lyrica_prismriver|Lyrica]] Prismriver
* Stage 5 Midboss/Boss, Final Stage Midboss: [[Konpaku Youmu]]
* Final Stage Boss: [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]]
* Extra Stage Midboss: [[Chen]]
* Extra Stage Boss, Phantasm Stage Midboss: [[Yakumo Ran]]
* Phantasm Stage Boss: [[Yakumo Yukari]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Perfect Cherry Blossom":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Perfect_Cherry_Blossom

title: shoot_the_bullet
body:
東方文花帖 "Touhou Bunkachou" ~ Shoot the Bullet
("Oriental Cultural Album")

Eleventh game in the [[Touhou]] series, sixth in the Windows generation, and the second spinoff, as well as the first spinoff using the mainstream danmaku shooter format. Labeled as "Touhou 9.5".

The game serves as a tie-in to the official fanbook [i]Bohemian Archive in Japanese Red[/i], starring [[Shameimaru Aya]] in her picture-taking spree involving various characters from [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] to [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]].

Preceded by [[Phantasmagoria of Flower View]] and followed by [[Mountain of Faith]].

h4. Characters

h5. Playable

* [[Shameimaru Aya]]

h5. Enemies

* Stage 1: [[Wriggle Nightbug]] and [[Rumia]]
* Stage 2: [[Cirno]] and [[Letty Whiterock]]
* Stage 3: [[Alice Margatroid]] and [[Kamishirasawa Keine]]
* Stage 4: [[Reisen Udongein Inaba]], [[Medicine Melancholy]] and [[Inaba Tewi]]
* Stage 5: [[Hong Meiling]] and [[Patchouli Knowledge]]
* Stage 6: [[Chen]] and [[Konpaku Youmu]]
* Stage 7: [[Izayoi Sakuya]] and [[Remilia Scarlet]]
* Stage 8: [[Yakumo Ran]] and [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]]
* Stage 9: [[Yagokoro Eirin]] and [[Houraisan Kaguya]]
* Final Stage: [[Onozuka Komachi]] and [[Shiki Eiki]]
* Extra Stage: [[Flandre Scarlet]], [[Yakumo Yukari]], [[Fujiwara no Mokou]] and [[Ibuki Suika]]

h4. External links

* "Touhou Wiki: Shoot the Bullet":http://en.touhouwiki.net/wiki/Shoot_the_Bullet

title: imminent_kiss
body:
The moment just before when two characters are about to [[kiss]].

The characters' mouths should be in close proximity to each other. Often there will be [[head_tilt|head tilting]], [[blush|blushing]], [[grabbing another's chin|chin grabbing]], [[closed eyes|eye closing]] (alternatively, direct [[eye_contact|eye-to-eye contact]]) and other such bodily cues present.

Not to be confused with [[incoming kiss]], which is an incoming kiss from the character to the viewer.

Depending on how ambiguous it is, this tag may overlap with [[after kiss]].

h4. See also

* [[grabbing another's chin]]
* [[kiss]]
** [[after kiss]]
** [[incoming kiss]]

title: scarlet_devil_mansion
body:
The setting of stages 4-6 and the extra stage of the [[Touhou]] game [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]].

The Scarlet Devil Mansion is described as a western-style mansion situated near [[Gensokyo]]'s [[Misty Lake]]. Official depictions are inconsistent on whether the mansion sits on the lake's far side, or on an island in the middle of the lake.

The home of [[Remilia Scarlet]], her [[sisters|sister]] [[Flandre Scarlet|Flandre]], friend [[Patchouli Knowledge]] and her little devil, [[Koakuma]], maid [[Izayoi Sakuya]] and the [[fairy maid (touhou)|]]s, and gatekeeper [[Hong Meiling]]. [[Rumia]], the fairy duo [[Cirno]] and [[Daiyousei]], and the mermaid [[Wakasagihime]], who all live at or near Misty Lake, are also frequently seen in the area.

Known for its immense library, the [[Voile]].

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: voile
body:
The fanon name for the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]'s [[library]] in [[Touhou]].

The stage 4 theme music of [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] is named ヴワル魔法図書館 ([i]Vuwaru Mahou Toshokan[/i], lit. "Voile, the Magic Library"). Based on this, some of the English-speaking fandom originally believed Voile to be the name of the [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]]'s library. However, this is not canon and [[ZUN]] has consistently referred to this library as "Scarlet Devil Mansion's Library" or "The Magic Library" in official works without any mention of "Voile". See also topic #9233.

The library is tended to by [[Patchouli Knowledge]], a large squad of [[fairy maid (touhou)|fairy maids]], and, allegedly, [[Koakuma]]. [[Kirisame Marisa]] frequently breaks in to "borrow" (read: steal) books, but occasionally will sit peacefully with Patchouli.

The library is often depicted as a massive tesseract (larger on the inside) or even a pocket dimension attached to the mansion.

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: misty_lake
body:
A vast, deep lake near the [[Forest of Magic]] in [[Touhou]]. The [[Scarlet Devil Mansion]] sits either on the far side, or on an island in the middle of the lake - canon is inconsistent on which. Fairies [[Cirno]] and [[Daiyousei]] live on the lake's edge, and mermaid [[Wakasagihime]] lives in the lake itself. It's believed [[Rumia]] also lives somewhere in the area.

Initial setting and stage 2 environment for [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] and stage 1 environment for [[Double Dealing Character]].

h4. See also

* [[Gensokyo]]

title: reimu_scarlet
body:
A character born in DeviantArt under repeated requests from username [i]TheRandom500[/i] to different artists, it's an alternate version of [[Hakurei Reimu]], where she very probably lost the battle during the events of [[Embodiment of Scarlet Devil]] against [[Remilia Scarlet]], and either she just bit her and turned her into another [[vampire]], or she turned into the third Scarlet sister. She changes her [[miko]] attire for something closer to Remilia's sense of fashion, on the vein of the [[lolita_fashion|lolita]] style (or else directly uses Remilia's outfit). Unlike the Scarlets, she most often wears a wide [[hat]] instead of [[mob_cap|mob caps]]. She can also be found with [[slit pupils]]. 

h4. See also

* [[List of Touhou fanwork tags]]

title: setsubun
body:
[b]Setsubun[/b] (節分, lit. "seasonal division") is the last day of winter in the Japanese calendar. It usually corresponds to February 3rd in the Gregorian calendar.

A ritual performed on this day is to throw roasted soybeans in order to drive away [[oni]]; this is known as [[mamemaki]].

In the Kansai region, it's customary to eat [[makizushi]] while facing this year's lucky direction; this practice is known as [[ehoumaki]].

h4. See also

* [[ehoumaki]]
* [[makizushi]]
* [[mamemaki]]
* [[masu]]
* [[Tag Group:Holidays and Celebrations]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Setsubun":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Setsubun

title: kanabou
body:
A traditional Japanese [[spiked club]]. Also known as tetsubou (鉄棒). Typically made of heavy oak wood and studded with iron [[spikes]], later versions were sheathed in iron or even made of solid iron. 

Often found in the hands of [[oni]], the great weight of the kanabou being considered a natural match for an oni's immense strength.

h4. See also

* [[spiked club]]
* [[Excalibolg]]

title: totoro
body:
Character in the [[Studio Ghibli]]'s film, [[Tonari no Totoro]].

Totoro is a forest spirit that lives in the largest camphor tree in a small village. He has [[grey fur]] and beige belly with grey arrows on his chest. He has pointy ears, long [[whiskers]] and large paws. His silhouette vaguely resembles that of an owl.

title: hagoita
body: A wooden [[paddle]] used by girls to play [[hanetsuki]] on [[New Year]]s day. Hagoita usually have ornate or detailed images painted on them making them very special. They can be bought at the end of the year (prior to New Years) during a special event called [i]hagoitaicha[/i] where various artists from local temples will compete against each other to make the best hagoita.

title: amakusa_(mobile_suit)
body:
[b]Amakusa / Jupiter Gundam[/b]
The Amakusa was a mobile weapon designed by Jupiter Empire remnants after the defeat of the original empire. Designed as a weapon of retribution, the Amakusa was a large mobile suit of its age post the miniaturization of mobile suits in the late UC, standing at 18 meters tall. It's size was not the point of danger for the Amakusa however, it was its primary AI, based off the combat patterns and newtype abilities of [[Amuro Ray]], the Amakusa was a fearsome and terrifying machine in combat, capable of predicting enemy movements and dodging attacks in milliseconds.

title: capotain
body:
A type of tall, narrow-brimmed hat with a flat top and slight conical profile. Historically heavily associated with the Puritan movement in England. Sometimes also called a "pilgrim hat" or a "sugarloaf hat", though these two names can also refer to other styles of hat.

In fiction this style of hat is frequently given to characters who work as witch hunters or inquisitors. In such cases the hat will usually be festooned with one or multiple [[leather belt]]s wrapped around the brim and/or crown.

Because of the above depiction of the capotain in fiction, this hat is also called a "witch hunter('s) hat".

title: akari_gin
body:
Akari Gin, also known as Gin Jellycat, is a Vietnamese [[Virtual YouTuber]].
A talented entertainer, one thing you could usually expect from Gin is her self-destructive tendency on stream. She enjoys playing FPS and would not hesitate trash-talking the enemies if need be. This gives her some sort of mafia vibes.

However, she could easily be frightened by sudden jump scares.

In addition, when reverted to her kid form. she is unusually wholesome and kittenish when around others.
Being a mixed species of a cat and jellyfish, Gin's most iconic feature is her cat ears and the pink jellyfish that usually attaches itself to her head.

She has swirling long [[orange hair]] with [[green eyes]], and a [[scar]] on her left one. She has three different outfits in total.

In her kid form, she wears a [[black hoodie]] and a pair of [[glasses]]. The [[jellyfish]] is absent from her head, and instead appears as a logo on the [[hoodie]].

Her first outfit is a [[school uniform]] with an [[orange coat]] and [[white shirt]] underneath.

Her second outfit consists of a yếm (a traditional Vietnamese bodice) with lotus pattern, brown jeans and a  [[black belt]]. A lotus [[tattoo]] is also visible on her right arm. The jellyfish is completely detached from her head, and is now wielding a bamboo spear.

h5.

title: griepe_gundam
body:
[b]OZ-19MASX Gundam Griepe[/b]

The OZ-19MASX Gundam Griepe is the ultimate G-UNIT, with high mobility in space and on earth. Secretly completed by Odel Bernett, its control system is specifically turned for his younger brother, Odin Bernett, and the mobile suit played a key role in stopping OZ Prize and the OZ-15AGX Hydra Gundam. Like the OZX-GU01LOB Gundam L.O. Booster, the Griepe can transform into a high-speed flight mode, bolstered by a revolutionary propulsion engine developed by Mark Bernett, the late father of Odel and Odin.

Like the earlier G-UNITs, the Griepe has a modular design and the PX System which takes advantage of the pilot's increased adrenaline during combat and also increases the performance of the mobile suit. However, the system has a time limit which if passed has serious consequences for both the pilot and the suit. The suit can use a beam lancer and the hyper mega particle launcher in MS Mode, while its MA Mode mounts a buster mega particle cannon under its nose. There is also the Assault Mode, halfway between MS and MA Mode, for firing the cannon without fully transforming. 

"Excerpt from the Gundam Wiki":[https://gundam.fandom.com/wiki/OZ-19MASX_Gundam_Griepe]

Walfas content can normally be identified by that style, further so if it uses the art from the applet.

title: oguri_oguri_(meme)
body:
Memetic cheer chant associated with the [[Umamusume]] character [[Oguri Cap (umamusume)|]]. (and the [[Oguri Cap (racehorse)|real-life Oguri Cap]]).

The racehorse [[Oguri Cap (racehorse)|]] was a national favorite in Japan and would attract crowds whenever he raced. The gathered fans would chant his name repeatedly from the stands, with unusual emphasis on the first two syllables.

The above is referenced during S1E6 of the [[Umamusume]] anime, with the crowd cheering for Oguri in a food-eating contest. Fanart of Oguri tend to use this chant when Oguri is involved in a food contest. The meme has also 'mutated' further with "ooh-goo-ri ooh-goo-ri" being used as a character-specific [i]onomatopoeia[/i] for when Oguri makes an appearance or when she is involved in her antics (eating lots of food, usually).

In written works, this chant is almost always repeated at least twice, and spelled as "オーグーリ" (ooguuri) with lengthened vowels on the first two syllables.

h4. See also

* [[Oguri Cap (Umamusume)]]
* [[Oguri Cap (racehorse)]]
other_names: オーグーリ!オーグーリ!

title: shadow_lord_(final_fantasy_xi)
body:
(from the Final Fantasy Wikia)

The Shadow Lord is the primary antagonist in Final Fantasy XI, and plays a supporting role in the Rise of the Zilart expansion pack storyline.

A decade before the Crystal War, the three nations of Vana'diel launched an expedition to investigate civilizations. The expedition included Ulrich, a powerful Hume swordsman, his friend Raogrimm, the Galkan Talekeeper and keeper of the race's memories, and Cornelia, a beautiful Hume female warrior.

The expedition through the Northlands was going as planned until a rift began forming between Ulrich and Raogrimm. The Galka was advocating peace with the Beastmen, a thought Ulrich did not agree with. Also, Raogrimm had proven to be the better warrior of the two, despite Ulrich's prowess with his blade. Then there was Cornelia; the Hume female and the Galka had developed a secret affection for one another, and Ulrich was green with envy.

The day finally came when Ulrich could no longer control his jealousy. The Hume surprised Raogrimm, pulling his sword and moving to kill him. Cornelia, faithful to the end, stepped in front of Ulrich's blade and Ulrich ran her through. Raogrimm took Cornelia's dead body in his arms and let out a mighty roar as the pain of losing the one he loved washed over him.

Ulrich hid the truth of what happened when he returned home from his expedition. The rage and sadness of the betrayal, however, resonated through the world and into the memory of the Magicite Crystals.

Thirty years after the event, as you find pieces of Magicite Crystals hidden throughout Vana'diel, you catch the first glimpse of the horrid betrayal: the event which ignited Raogrimm's hatred and allowed him to resurrect himself as the Shadow Lord.

Twenty years before the dawn of the Age of Adventurers, a terrifying demon emerged from the frozen heights of Xarcabard. Nobody knew where this demon came from, and none of the nations were prepared for his wrath. This kindred demon united the beastmen of Vana'diel against the five races of Altana in a war referred to nowadays as the Crystal War, or the Great War of 20 years ago.

This demon was called the Shadow Lord.

At the conclusion of the Crystal War, an elite squad of warriors fought through Castle Zvahl Baileys and cornered the Shadow Lord in his throne room. There the mighty demon was defeated... or so the world thought.

In the the Age of Adventurers, the dark spirit of the Shadow Lord began to stir once more. Motivated by this great force, the beastmen of Vana'diel set in motion a plot to revive their revered leader. Before this plot could envelop the world in a second Great War, a young adventurer joined forces with veterans of the original war to foil the sinister plot. In the end, the Shadow Lord did rise again, but the adventurer was there waiting. An epic battle ensued, and at the end of the battle only the adventurer is left standing.

The Shadow Lord then reveals his true identity: he is Raogrimm, the former Galka Talekeeper consumed by the torment and pain of generations of his people.

In this final defeat, the Shadow Lord believes he can rest peacefully.

Defeating the Shadow Lord will grant the player the rare Rank 6.

title: frogging
body:
[i]Ornamental braid or coat fastenings consisting of spindle-shaped buttons and loops.[/i]
[tn]— Oxford Languages dictionary[/tn]

That fancy (usually golden) braid you sometimes see on dress uniforms. Originally used to fasten coats and jackets, but some of the more elaborate ones (featuring fancy loops and extensive length) are purely ornamental. Napoleonic era military uniforms tend to feature extensive frogging. 

Some modern day parade dress and marching band uniforms still retain ornamental frogging. Several [[Umamusume]] characters feature frogging on their racing outfits; these outfits also tend to resemble parade dress uniforms (e.g. [[Symboli Rudolf (Umamusume)|]]'s).

[[Kantai Collection|Kancolle]]'s [[Kongou (Kancolle)|]]-class modified miko uniform also features frogging on the front (where it acts as a clasp holding the coat-like strips of cloth together). This is done in a shape resembling that of a sacred shimenawa rope.

Traditionally the Chinese [[tangzhuang]] (and some other Chinese clothes) are also fastened together using froggings, but it is best to avoid tagging such examples with frogging unless they are visually distinctive (i.e. thicker and/or more elaborate braids).

title: queen_orchis
body:
An NPC character from [i][[Granblue Fantasy]][/i].

[[Black Knight (granblue Fantasy)|]]'s childhood friend and current queen of the Erste Empire. Before the events of the story, Orchis's soul was separated from her body, leaving behind an empty vessel that would eventually grow its own ego called Orchid (tagged here as [[orchis]]). Orchis eventually returns to her own body while Orchid moves into a similar, doll-like golem body. 

Queen Orchis has the appearance of a young girl with long silver blue hair and brown eyes. To differentiate herself from Orchid, she's often depicted with a decorated blue dress, ponytail, and crown. 

This tag should be used for images of Orchis either before she was separated from her body or after she rejoins with it. Images of the "emotionless" Orchid using Orchis's body should be tagged [[orchis]].

title: shishimai
body:
Japanese [[lion dance]]. Generally performed during the Japanese [[New Year]] and on Buddha's Birthday, or as part of noh and kabuki performances.

The shishimai costume usually features a red lacquered wooden (or plastic) mask with visible teeth, white hair and a green "robed" body. The "robe" section sometimes has swirly wind/cloud patterns done in white.

The lion [[noh mask]] worn by [[Hata no Kokoro]] is the same mask as the shishimai mask.

title: pipette
body:
Laboratory tool used in chemistry and biology to transfer fixed quantities of liquid.

Most pipettes depicted in anime-related art are [i]pasteur pipettes[/i], consisting of a tapered glass (sometimes plastic) tube with a bulb on one end that is depressed to draw in and dispense liquids. The overall shape resembles an oversized eye dropper, and the pipette is sometimes referred to as such.

title: solo_(strider)
body:
[i]"I got you..."[/i]. - Solo (from [i]Strider[/i])

A character from the [[strider_(video_game)|Strider]] science fiction [[video game]] series. 

[b]Solo[/b] (ソロ [i]Soro[/i]) is a recurring enemy, appearing in all versions of the first Strider coin-op as well as both its sequels.

A hired assassin and bounty hunter, Solo's body is fitted with a reinforced [[power armor]] that grants him free-flying capabilities and a speed boost that makes him hard to catch by ordinary human eyes. His speed level is such that he leaves after-images as he moves around. 

Solo's weapons of choice are two: a large cannon-like weapon in his left hand, and a gun in his right one. His left hand weapon is a flamethrower with a built-in missile launcher on top. He later gets an upgraded form and a new weapon in the form of energy rings he can create and throw at his enemies. 

Solo is a ruthless and dangerous killer, and considers himself [[Strider Hiryuu]]'s rival. He's, however, not quite on Hiryuu's level of skill or ability.

The map features Town Takeovers based on [[Caustic (apex legends)|]], [[Crypto (apex Legends)|]], [[Octane (apex legends)|]], and [[Wraith (apex legends)|]], and was temporarily home to the [[Mirage (apex legends)|]] Voyage.

title: world_heroes
body:
[b]World Heroes[/b] is a competitive fighting game series of 4 arcade titles from the 90s created by ADK originally produced for the [[Neo Geo]] MVS arcade cabinets with the assistance of [[SNK]], though some of the games in the series were also ported to the Neo Geo AES and Neo-Geo CD platforms, as well as some non-SNK platforms such as the Super Famicom and the Sega Mega Drive. A fifth title [i]World Heroes Pocket[/i] was announced for release on the Neo Geo Pocket, but was canceled.

The general premise is that a scientist, Dr. Brown, having perfected a time machine, organized a tournament for various fighters throughout all of history to combat each other. True to this plot, many of the fighters are based on actual historical figures, while some are fictional ones.

h4.Related Games and Date of Release

* [i]World Heroes[/i] (1992)
* [i]World Heroes 2[/i] (1993)
* [i]World Heroes 2 Jet[/i] (1994)
* [i]World Heroes Perfect[/i] (1995)
* [i]World Heroes Gorgeous[/i] (Series compilation released in 2007 in Japan and during 2008 as [i]World Heroes Anthology[/i] in the rest of the world)

h4.Related Characters

* [[hanzo_(world_heroes)|Hanzo]]
* [[fuuma_kotarou_(world_heroes)|Fuuma]] 
* [[Brocken (world heroes)|]]

title: erick_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Erick[/b] (エリック) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting series. 

Erick is a member of a proud [[viking]] clan. He roams the seas, expanding the might of the vikings. When confronted about the tournament by Dr. Brown, he enters it, saying that the viking pride will not let him lose.     

He was born in Norway on March 20, 953.

The character is based in the legendary viking sailor and founder of the first Nordic settlement in Greenland, "Erik Thorvaldsson":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Erik_the_Red.
other_names: エリック・ザ・バイキング

title: captain_kidd_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Captain Kidd[/b] (キャプテンキッド, [i]Kyaputen Kiddo[/i]) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Captain Kidd was a pirate that robbed all the treasures he could find. Getting bored of having no action at all, he enters the tournament by Dr. Brown. 

He was born in [[Scotland]] in November 19, 1544.

The character is based in the Scottish sailor turned pirate, "Captain William Kidd":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captain_Kidd.

title: brocken_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Brocken[/b]  (ブロッケン, [i]Burokenuru[/i]) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Brocken is a [[Wehrmacht]] [[cyborg]] developed by Dr. Brown for the [[Nazi]] soldiers during [[World War II]]. He travels to face his enemies from different eras and to prove that the power of the military and science are the greatest of them all.

He was born in [[Germany]] in October 24, 1891.

title: rasputin_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Rasputin[/b] (ラスプーチン, [i]Rasupuuchin[/i], Распутин) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Rasputin is the leader of a pansexual love cult based on Russia. He is also a [[wizard]] with great knowledge in magic. Rasputin fights the other World Heroes, while preaching about the love all mankind should have. 

He was born in [[Russia]] in December 29, 1864.

The character is based on [[Grigori Rasputin]], a legendary Russian mystic who believed that to purge temptation, one had to be in contact with it in all its forms (which includes [[sex]]). Grigori Rasputin was believed to be a healer, psychic, visionary and prophet.

title: julius_carn
body:
[b]Julius Carn[/b] is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

J. Carn is the the strongest fighter of the Mongolian people. He led the powerful Mongolian army into many victories and conquests. 

He was born in [[Mongolia]] in February 19, 1162.

The character is based in the ancient Mongolian conqueror, founder and emperor of the Mongolian Empire [[Genghis Khan]].

title: izumo_ryoko
body:
[b]Izumo Ryoko[/b] is a character from the [[World Heroes]] fighting game series. 

Ryoko is a Japanese [[judo]] practitioner and sports superstar who fills the hearts of the people in her hometown with pride. Because of this she was recruited by Dr. Brown for the tournament.

Ryoko was born in Japan in May 12, 1976.

The character's hairstyle and design were inspired by real-life judoka, 2 times Olympic gold medal winner and 7 times world champion, "Tani Ryoko.":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ryoko_Tani The main details from her background are also modeled after the title character of the anime series [[yawara_a_fashionable_judo_girl|Yawara!]].

title: mudman_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Mudman[/b] is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Mudman is a revered [[shaman]], witch doctor and a holy warrior to his tribe. He fights in the name of his god Fah Fa, to rid the world of evil forces and protect nature, hoping to one day earn his right in the heavens.    

He was born in "Papua New Guinea":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Guinea in January 11, 1XXX.

The character is based in the "New Guinean headhunters":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/New_Guinea#Pre-colonial_history and is also a homage to Daijiro Morohoshi's manga, [i]Mudmen[/i].

title: jack_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Jack[/b] (ジャック) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Jack is a psychopathic Victorian England [[punk]] assassin who considers himself as "the greatest serial killer of them all". Jack joins the competition when he realises that there will be many strong people to cut down.     

He was born in [[England]] in December 24, 1880.

The character is based in both the infamous British murderer  [[Jack The Ripper]] and [[Freddy Krueger]].

title: son_gokuu_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Son Gokuu[/b] (孫悟空) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

The "monkey king" from Chinese folklore, Son Gokuu is a tremendous warrior that loves adventure. Gokuu seeks more and more adventure anywhere he can go, so he entered the World Heroes tournament. 

Gokuu was born in ancient [[China]] in November 22, 100.

The character is based in the legendary Chinese tale of [[Sun Wukong]].

title: ryofu_(world_heroes)
body:
[b]Ryofu[/b] (リョフ) is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

A Chinese hero and legend, Ryofu was bored and wanted more adventures, so he entered the World Heroes competition when prompted by Dr. Brown. 

Ryofu was born in ancient [[China]] in 11XX.

The character is based in the legendary Chinese general and warlord, [[Lu Bu|Lü Bu]].

title: kim_dragon
body:
[b]Kim Dragon[/b] is a character from the [[World Heroes]] competitive fighting [[video game]] series. 

Kim is a Korean superstar of [[martial arts]] movies. His fame is compared to that of singers, but he wants to be a great fighter as well.

He was born in South [[Korea]] in November 27, 1940.

The character is a tribute to martial arts film icon, [[Bruce Lee]]. The only difference between the two is that Kim is Korean and Lee was Chinese. Some of his moves are also loosely based on [[Kenshiro]] from [[Hokuto no Ken]] (Fist of the North Star).

title: kaiser_gridknight
body:
[b]Kaiser Gridknight (カイゼルグリッドナイト Kaizeru Guriddonaito)[/b] is a combination of Gridknight, the mecha Dynazenon and the Kaiju Goldburn. Gridknight takes [[Dyna Soldier]]'s place in the usual [[Dynazenon (character)|]] combination sequence while [[Goldburn]] attaches itself onto the chestplate. Additionally, Dyna Soldier transforms into the [[Dynamic Cannon]] and is gripped on the shoulder by [[Gridknight (ssss.gridman)|]]'s free hand.

h4. Abilities

** [b]Energy Bullet[/b] : Kaiser Gridknight shoots a purple energy bullet from his hand.

** [b]Kaiser Knight Double Storm (カイゼルナイトダブルストーム Kaizeru Naito Daburu Sutōmu)[/b] : Twin energy beams fired from the hands.

** [b]Rex Grid Fire (レックスグリッドファイヤー Rekkusu Guriddo Faiyā)[/b] : After charging up energy, the Dynamic Cannon fires a powerful purple energy beam.

** [b]Kaiser Knight Circular (カイゼルナイトサーキュラ Kaizeru Naito Sākyura)[/b] : Kaiser Gridknight forms a circle of energy in his palm, which is used to slice through an enemy. The circle's circumference is able to expand and affect a large area.
other_names: カイゼルグリッドナイト

title: iori_yuzuru
body:

title: saigyouji_yuyuko_(living)
body:
Pictures depicting what [[Saigyouji Yuyuko]] looked like when she was alive. There is no official depiction of this version of Yuyuko within the [[Touhou]] series. She is generally shown with [[Yakumo Yukari]] since they came in contact with each other according to Touhou's backstory. It's unclear whether she had [[black hair|black]] or [[brown hair]] like a normal Japanese woman, or her distinctive [[pink hair]] during her mortal life.

This tag also applies to pictures depicting Yuyuko's suicide - the [[irony]] tag is not necessary.

title: shamal
body: A character introduced in [[Mahou Shoujo Lyrical Nanoha A's]], voiced by [[Yuzuki Ryouka]]. She appears in neither the previous series Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha nor the later story Triangle Heart, but she does appear in Magical Girl Lyrical Nanoha StrikerS. Shamal is one of the Wolkenritter, a creation of the Book of Darkness. She often plays the role of a team medic, especially to [[Yagami Hayate]]. Shamal's weapon is a portal-creating ring called [[Klarwind]], and as a magical creation, she has no familiar. She is named for the Maserati Shamal, much like characters of Magic Knight Rayearth are named for cars (for example, Opel Zafira).

title: tenkuu_no_escaflowne
body:
"Escaflowne of the Heavens", also called "Vision of Escaflowne"

A 26-episode anime series running from April until September 1996, with official art done by [[Yuuki Nobuteru]]. Escaflowne is a fantasy-based story that contains both shoujo and shounen storytelling aspects due to different directors handling the anime. Imagawa Yasuhiro tried to give it a more shounen feel prior to leaving, then Akane Kazuki took over and gave it more shoujo elements.

There is also a 90-minute film retelling the anime called [i][[Escaflowne (movie)|Escaflowne - A Girl in Gaea]][/i], but with vastly different character personalities. Both [[kanzaki hitomi|Hitomi]] and [[van fanel|Van]] are more depressed and emotional than their anime counterparts.

h4.External links

* "Wikipedia: The Vision of Escaflowne":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Vision_of_Escaflowne

title: demon_mages
body:
[b]The Demon Mages[/b] is a two-issue miniseries by [[Crybringer]], published by AngryVikingPress.

Ziggy, a bondswoman-for-hire, has a spectacular failure on her last assignment.  Ruining the stage premier of a starlet named Ari, the two go on a madcap chase, with the authorities on their heels.  Along the way, a thrill-seeking orphan named Tara, pokes her nose in the wrong place at the wrong time, getting caught up in Ziggy & Ari’s fight.

The story will continue, as the worst night of their lives is not yet over…

h4. Characters

* [[Ziggy Kakziga]], a laconic [[basilisk]] girl.
* [[Ari Laharis]], a brassy [[snake hair|medusa]] starlet.
* [[Tess Tesryon]], an obtuse little [[demon girl]].
* [[Tara Olphoros]], a plucky [[drow]] teenager.

h4. External links

* "Official website":[http://avpressstaff.dot5hosting.com/demonmages1.html]
* "Official Tumblr":[http://thedemonmages.tumblr.com]

title: help:post_syntax
body:
When searching for posts, the following variations on search parameters can be used.

h5. Post ID

This is the post ID of the post being queried.

* Qualifier: [code]*_id[/code]
* Example: [code]search[post_id][/code]

h5. Post tags match

The post query of the search term matches the post of the record attribute.

* Qualifier: [code]*_tags_match[/code]
* Example: [code]search[post_tags_match][/code]

See [[Help:Cheatsheet]] for more information on post query search format.

h5. Attribute chaining

See [[Help:Chaining syntax]] for details on this parameter format.
See [[API:Posts]] for the list of available search terms.

h4#see-also. See also

* [[API:Posts]]
* [[Help:Chaining syntax]]
* [[Help:Cheatsheet]]
* [[Help:API]]

title: borderlands_1
body:
Borderlands is a science fiction first-person shooter game with RPG elements. The game was created by Gearbox Software and published by 2K Games. It was released onto Microsoft Windows, [[PlayStation 3]], [[Xbox 360]], and Mac OS X. Borderlands was officially released on October 20, 2009. The game was later ported to [[PlayStation 4]] and [[Xbox One]] in 2019, and [[Nintendo Switch]] in 2020.

A sequel ([[Borderlands 2]]) was released in September 2012.

title: arai-san_mansion
body:
A series by [[Abubu]] featuring characters from [[Kemono Friends]] that takes place inside of an anomalous apartment complex. The story initially follows [[common_raccoon_(kemono_friends)|Arai-san]], who is trying to get back home, but also features the adventures of a team of [[giant_otter_(kemono_friends)_(kuro_(kurojill))|Giant Otters]] as they explore the dangers and other oddities of the building as well as a number of [[original]] characters.

Note: Japanese word "マンション":[https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E3%83%9E%E3%83%B3%E3%82%B7%E3%83%A7%E3%83%B3] ([i]manshon[/i]), while it is borrowed from English "mansion", is rather used to mean "large apartment" in Japan.

h4. Original Characters
In order of appearance:
* [[gachi-oji (abubu)|Gachi-Oji]]
* [[carnivore (kemono friends) (abubu)|Carnivore]]
* [[herbivore (kemono friends) (abubu)|Herbivore]]
* [[elevator girl (abubu)|Elevator girl]]
* [[scavenger-chan (abubu)|Scavenger-chan]]

title: shiho_hahnenfuss
body:
A mobile suit pilot from the [[Gundam SEED]] series.  She was originally slated to be a side character in the original Gundam SEED.  However, the intended voice actor, one of the opening theme singers for Gundam SEED, turned down the role.  This act probably saved Shiho's life, as every other character voiced by a theme singer died horribly. She was then voiced by Ohmoto Makiko in games, best known for voicing [[Kirby]]. 

Shiho is a subordinate of [[Yzak Joule]], and can often be seen standing behind him in Gundam SEED: Destiny.

body:
The demonic tome [[Alice Margatroid]] used as a weapon in the Extra Stage of [[Touhou]] [[Mystic Square]] and continues to keep on her person in later appearances. Using the book appears to unlock Alice's full potential, but due to her cowardly inner nature and her fear of the implications if she lost a fight at full power, Alice normally keeps the tome wrapped in two padlocked leather bands, primarily relying on her dolls like [[Shanghai Doll| Shanghai]] and [[Hourai Doll| Hourai]] in combat. Using the tome allowed Alice to fight on the level of an Extra Stage Boss, compared to her later showing as the Stage Three boss of [[Perfect Cherry Blossom]]

A common theory attempting to link the PC98 and Windows eras of canon is that use of the Grimoire is what changed Alice from [[Alice Margatroid (PC-98)|a human]] into a Magician Youkai.

title: mini-hakkero

The original 八卦炉 (Japanese pronunciation:[i]hakkero[/i]) appeared in [[Journey to the West]] for the first time.

title: glowing_streaks
body:
Streaks of light trailing behind a(n apparently) glowing object, body part or entity.

Usually associated with [[glowing eyes|glowing]] [[red eyes|]], especially when a character taps into their super-powered 'evil' side. Sometimes this may also manifest as a trailing light (usually blue or red) behind a weapon with a particularly keen edge.  

In animated 3D media (particularly in video games) this effect is commonly depicted as a trailing particle effect.

title: bodycon
body:
("[i]bodikon[/i]," wasei-eigo for "body conscious")

A Japanese fashion of form-fitting clothing, typically tight [[short dress|minidresses]]. The look was pioneered in the 1990s by the dancers of the Shibaura nightclub, Juliana's. 

A pair of [[hand fan|fans]] is a common bodycon accessory.

title: leaf_fan
body:
A [[hand fan]] made out of leaves (or a single [[leaf]]).

Often depicted as a single palm or banana leaf repurposed for use as a fan. Tiny characters may instead use a fern leaf.

Another common variant is the "palm leaf fan", made from dried palm leaf ribs woven together (some are made from bamboo leaves, despite the name). These are shaped like [[uchiwa]] and often used in a similar manner (e.g. "to stoke the flames of a grill":[/posts/3665865]).

[b]Do not[/b] use this for [[hauchiwa]], as those are made out of feathers despite some of them taking a leaf-like appearance.

h4. Notable artifacts

* Banshousen/Bajiao-shan [tn]("Banana Leaf Fan")[/tn]
** Magical artifact usually depicted as a "gilded banana leaf fan":[/posts/1071466]. Originated from [[Journey to the West]], but makes frequent appearances in other copyrights.

h4. Notable characters

* [[Tie Shan Gongzhu|]] ([[Journey to the West]])
** Original wielder of the Bajiao-shan.
* [[Chi-Chi (Dragon Ball)|]] ([[Dragon Ball]])
** Sometimes depicted carrying the Banshousen.
* [[Misato_(Senran_Kagura)|]] ([[Senran Kagura]])
** Wields a fan made out of multiple '[[tanuki]] leaves' bound together at their petioles.
* [[Kurama_(urusei_yatsura)|]] ([[Urusei Yatsura]])
* [[Shiftry]] ([[Pokemon]])
** Hands are leaf fans. Sometimes not depicted as 'fan-like', so avoid tagging leaf_fan for those cases.
* [[Lilina (Fire Emblem)|]] ([[Fire Emblem]])
** Carries a miniature palm leaf fan (single leaf) in her "Beachside Bloom" summer skin.
* [[Shameimaru Aya]] ([[Touhou]])
** [b]CAREFUL![/b] Often depicted with a [[hauchiwa]] that resembles a maple leaf. [b]Do not[/b] tag those as leaf_fan. Tag [[hauchiwa]] instead. 
** Sometimes depicted with an actual maple leaf fan. Tag those as leaf_fan, not [[hauchiwa]]. If unsure, default to [[hauchiwa]].

h4. Tag usage notes

* Tag fans made out of leaves (or a single leaf) with leaf_fan.
**  For single 'unmodified' leaves, avoid using leaf_fan if the character is [i]just[/i] holding the leaf. Tag leaf_fan only if the character is actively using the leaf as a fan, or is holding it in a way suggestive of an intent to use it as a fan.
* [b]DO NOT[/b] tag [[hauchiwa]] with leaf_fan.
** If unsure whether a fan is a [[hauchiwa]] or an actual leaf_fan, default to [[hauchiwa]].

body:
The fourth mothership title in Namco's [[tales of (series)|Tales of...]] series for the Playstation 2 and rereleased on the Playstation Portable. It was never localized to the West, and is the first game to use Grade as a form of endgame currency. It is a direct sequel to [[Tales of Destiny]], starring Stahn Aileron's son Kyle Dunamis.

TOD2 is not to be confused for the renamed title of [[Tales of Eternia]] in the West due to copyright reasons. This tag is for the Tales of Destiny sequel.

title: trickster_lucy
body:
Lucy is a world-renowned criminal who puts fear into even the wealthiest man with the most powerful security systems.

She is a master of disguise, escape, misdirection and magic. If you thought you caught a glimpse of her, she'll vanish. The moment you think she's in your grasp, you'll be empty-handed. Lucy is a genius in any knowledge or skills related to crimes. She is naturally talented in magic, gymnastics, and athletics. She also has doctorates in Medicine, Security, Psychology, and Alchemy. Each degree she earned has a different name written on them, though. She's known as the princess of crime among criminals, and lots of them uses her name out of admiration.

She only commits crimes for the fun and thrill. Her crimes' patterns and their severity fluctuate depending on her mood. If you can see her and she's almost within your grasp, that means she wants to play. When she's not in the mood, you would pass by without even noticing her or her criminal act.
 Lucy's favorite part of committing a crime is the thrill, excitement, and chaos happening during the chase. Apparently, a just hero tenaciously chasing after her gives her the most fun. Using her fantastic wordplay to cloud the hero's judgment and playing mind games is also an added bonus. Of course, just because she had fun, that doesn't mean she'll return the stolen items or money.

There's very little known about Lucy. No one knows her exact age, her past, even whether the name 'Lucy is her real name. Some people suggest Lucy became a trickster because of her troubled youth or the corruption in society, but she merely laughs at all these analyses. 'It's a grave mistake to think something other than me created my identity,' she claims. She's just having fun!

Despite being a criminal for her enjoyment, Lucy's not great at making jokes. She wants to deliver a fitting joke during the act but always ends up delivering the punch line in the wrong way.
 Even if she comes up with something clever, her delivery usually ruins it. Lucys feelings get very hurt when the tension dies down from her bad delivery of jokes.

title: javelin_(gundam)
body:
[b]RGM-122 Javelin[/b]

The RGM-122 Javelin was a successor unit to the earlier [b]Jamesgun[/b] mobile suit. Featuring two shot-lancers inspired by those used by the crossbone vanguard, and possessing high-mobility, the Javelin was a distinct upgrade to the Jamesgun. However by the time of the [[Zanscare]] invasion, the Javelin was already a aged unit and was outclassed by many of the Zancare's mobile suits.

title: sonic_adventure_2
body:
[b][i]Sonic Adventure 2[/i][/b] (ソニックアドベンチャー 2, [i]Sonikku Adobenchā Tsū[/i]) is a 3D action platformer game developed by [[Sonic Team]] and published by [[Sega]], released in [[2001]] for the [[sega dreamcast|Sega Dreamcast]] and ported to [[GameCube]] as [b]Sonic Adventure 2: Battle[/b], it was also ported to PC, [[PlayStation 3]], and [[Xbox 360]] as a downloadable title. The story focuses on two dynamics; "[b]Hero[/b]" and "[b]Dark[/b]", with three characters in each, one character from one side playing similar to the other. It ended up being one of the last few games released for the Dreamcast before it's eventual demise.

h4. Characters
h5. Hero Side
* [[Sonic the hedgehog|Sonic the Hedgehog]]
* [[tails (sonic)|Miles "Tails" Prower]]
* [[Knuckles the Echidna]]

h5. Dark Side
* [[Shadow the Hedgehog]]
* [[Dr. Eggman]]
* [[Rouge the Bat]]
h5. Other

* [[Amy Rose]]
* [[Chao (sonic)|Chao]]
* [[Gerald Robotnik]]
* [[Maria Robotnik]]

They have [[red eyes]], [[rabbit ears]], and elaborate military-styled outfits. They are named after types of ammunition (00 buckshot, .45 Colt, .410 shotgun shell, and 5.56mm NATO).

* [[Chiester00]] - [[Blonde hair]] and [[eyepatch]].
* [[Chiester45]] - [[Pink hair]] and [[twintails]].
* [[Chiester410]] - [[Blue hair]].
* [[Chiester556]] - [[Purple Hair]].

title: kamishiro_seren
body:
An [[original]] character by [[Rakurakutei Ramen]]. 

Distinguishable by her [[brown hair]], headwear that resembles [[rabbit ears]], and is usually seen wearing a jean [[miniskirt]] with black [[thighhighs]] and a long sleeved shirt.

Owner of the shop Karindou and a magician, she's roughly a millennium in age. She also has a knack for keeping and creating (generally odd) things inside a store room which exists in some other limitless dimension.

She is usually lazy and feckless, and only occasionally shows her serious side when the people she cares about are under threat.  She was once known and feared as a godslayer, but has been hiding for so long nobody really remembers her anymore, and she'd rather just do nothing but relax for all eternity.  

Her headband is actually a magic dampener made of angel wing that restricts her huge magic potential so that she can cast basic utility spells, rather than only destructive ones.  She prefers using her magic for her own convenience, and often uses it on silly and/or stupid things, like using dimensional magic to transform pudding into swimming pool size.

Her mentor and "mother" is [[Elza Straherz]].  Their relationship is complicated by Elza's perversion, but she is nevertheless respectful of Elza's knowledge.  At times, she actually reverts to a more childish personality in the face of Elza on the rare occasions Elza actually starts acting the mother.

She is "mother" to [[ujikintoki_tamaryu|Tamaryu]] as well as [[ujikintoki_kinka|Kinka]] and [[ujikintoki_ginka|Ginka]], herself.  In truth, Seren is immortal and was exiled in the first place because she slew Tamaryu's previous incarnation, used Tamaryu's body as magical ingredients for a potion to grant herself immortality, only to wind up caring for Tamaryu's new form.  

Like Elza, her physical form is actually of her own choosing - she actually has a more busty true form, but chooses a more sporty form willfully, and has [[breast envy]] simply because "it's more fun to long for things you don't have".  

When she temporarily was in her child form, she had to use a cat ear headband, and was in danger from the pedophillic advances of [[Tatsuta Rindou]].

title: mariah_(jojo)
body:
Mariah (localized as Mahriha in English) is one of the antagonists of [[jojo no kimyou na bouken|JoJo's Bizarre Adventure]]. Her Stand is [[Bastet (stand)|]], based on the Egyptian tarot, and deity of the same name. Her name is based on artist [[Mariah Carey]].

Her ability involves the manipulation of magnetism and metal, often wielding the ability to control large metallic objects through it.

It is heavily implied that she is deeply in love with [[Dio Brando]], often comparing male enemies to him. She also may be a romantic, going as far to actively look for a romantic relationship.

title: musicus!
body:
Musicus tells the story of [[Tsushima Kei]], whose future was pretty much laid out for him the day he was born. As the son of a long line of doctors, he was fated to follow suit and go through medical college. However, he ended up struggling to complete night classes and finish his education, so he dropped out. Feeling depressed and confused, he questions if he ever truly wanted to become a doctor. This leads him to open up the doors to the rock ‘n roll lifestyle and follow a new dream.

title: duel_gundam
body:
[b]GAT-X102 Duel Gundam[/b]
The first Gundam unit developed by the Earth Alliance's G-Project, a balanced and high-performing machine that served as the design base for all subsequent units. It was then stolen and primarily piloted by [[Yzak Joule]]. After being damaged in battle with the [[Aile Strike Gundam]], the Duel was upgraded with the Assault Shroud add-on armor and weapons package, and now bears the powerful shoulder mounted Shiva 115mm Railgun.

title: shoelaces
body:
A pair of strings or cords, one for each [[shoes|shoe]], finished off at both ends with stiff sections, known as aglets.

A shoelace typically passes through a series of holes, eyelets, loops or hooks on either side of a shoe. Loosening the lacing allows the shoe to open wide enough for the [[feet|foot]] to be inserted or removed. Tightening the lacing and tying off the ends secures the foot firmly within the shoe.

title: goblin_(last_origin)
body:
Character from [[Last Origin]]. The only known male Bioroid, the Black River T-1 Goblin was based on the genes of Black River CEO [[Angel Rioboros]]. However, high levels of aggression resulted in incidents of units going berserk and killing innocent civilians and prisoners of war. The Goblin was recalled, and an investigation revealed that the influence of nanomachines caused excessive levels of testosterone secretion in these units, making them susceptible to incidents of berserk behavior.

This discovery soon prompted global bans on male Bioroids, and Black River developed the female [[Brownie (last Origin)|]] as a replacement for the Goblin, though Rioboros secretly placed its remaining stock of Goblin units in underground freezer storage.

Don't use this tag if you don't see penetration about to occur. This differs from [[grinding]] in that grinding is about rubbing the penis against the vagina, while imminent vaginal is about the penis being about to penetrate the vagina.

title: imminent_rape
body:
When a character is about to be [[rape]]d, but the penetration hasn't happened yet.

This is different from [[you gonna get raped]] because the context in that tag is supposed to be humorous, whereas this is considered serious sexual assualt.

Add [[imminent vaginal]] and/or [[imminent anal]] as well to show which orifice is about to be penetrated. This only covers the general fact that rape is about to occur.

If the partners are about to engage in consensual sex, or if you're not sure as to whether or not the image depicts imminent rape, use [[imminent penetration]] instead.

title: penis_on_pussy

title: imminent_double_penetration
body:
When [[double penetration]] is about to occur.

This includes both when the character hasn't been penetrated yet (post #2770792), and when the character is about to receive a second penetration (post #3245998). This does not include [[oral]] penetration or [[spitroast]]ing, however.

h4.See also

* [[imminent anal]]
* [[imminent vaginal]]
* [[imminent penetration]]
* [[imminent gangbang]]

title: 00_xn_raiser
body:
[b]GN-0000+GNR-010/XN 00 XN Raiser[/b]
The fusion of the [[00 Gundam]] and the XN Raiser, a variant of the [[0 Raiser]] which included two GN Buster Sword III large blades. The 00 XN Raiser (pronounced "sun-riser") was a much more specialized close-combat version of the [[00 Raiser]] akin to the Seven Sword modification for the base 00 Gundam.

title: yoda
body:
One of the main characters from the [[Star Wars]] [[Science fiction]] and [[Fantasy]] series.

[b]Yoda[/b] is the ultimate [[Jedi]] Master. He is good, humble, wise, and several hundred years old. Yoda has trained many Jedi for nearly 900 years. 

He is a very small humanoid green skinned [[alien]] who has great and powerful fighting abilities, as well as a complete and absolute control of all the Jedi "Force" powers.

title: armory
body:
An armory is any location designed for the safe storage and access of [[weapon|weapons]], [[armor]], and [[ammunition]]. Tag only if there is a rack showcasing weapons, armor, or ammunition or if it is otherwise apparent from the image that it is an armory.

A sub-armory is a temporary location (such as a guard post) that can function as an armory under proper supervision. For the purpose of tagging, this is the same as an armory.

h4. See also

* [[Weapon]]
** [[Gun]]
* [[Armor]]
* [[Ammunition]]

title: cotton_swab
body:
Cotton swabs consist of a small wad of cotton wrapped around one or both ends of a short rod, usually made of either wood, rolled paper, or plastic. They are commonly used in a variety of applications including first aid, cosmetics application, cleaning, and arts and crafts. The term "Q-tip" is often used as a genericized trademark for cotton swabs in the USA.


For ear cleaners with a fuzzy tip on one end and small spoon on the other end, use [[mimikaki]].

h4. See also
* [[cotton_ball]]

title: holo_caster
body:
A communication device in [i][[pokemon xy|Pokémon X and Y]][/i]. It was developed by Lysander Labs, and allows people to communicate using holograms.

[[Trevor (pokemon)|]] carries one around his neck.

h4. See also
* [[Xtransceiver]]

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia: Holo Caster":[http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Holo_Caster]

title: xtransceiver
body:
A communication device in [i][[pokemon bw|Pokémon Black and White]][/i] and [i][[pokemon bw2|Black 2 and White 2]][/i]. It resembles a [[wristwatch]] and allows people to communicate through video calls. Its name is pronounced as "cross-transceiver" and it comes in various different colors:
* [[Hilbert (pokemon)|]]: Blue
* [[Hilda (pokemon)|]]: Pink
* [[Nate (pokemon)|]] and [[Curtis (pokemon)|]]: Red
* [[Rosa (pokemon)|]] and [[Yancy (pokemon)|]]: Yellow
* [[Hugh (pokemon)|]]: Purple

h4. See also
* [[Holo Caster]]

h4. External links
* "Bulbapedia: Xtransceiver":[http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Xtransceiver]
* "Bulbapedia: Dropped Item":[http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Dropped_Item]

title: nobunaga_no_yabou
body:
A long-running series of historical strategy games by Koei about the Sengoku period of Japan. Known in the west as [b]Nobunaga's Ambition[/b].

This series (of all things) was made into a crossover with [[Pokemon]] as [[Pokemon Conquest]], known in Japan as [b]Pokémon + Nobunaga no Yabou[/b].

title: sakura_kakumei
body:
A mobile gacha game based on the [[Sakura Taisen]] series. Features a brand new cast in an alternate timeline from the rest of the series, and predominantly features [[mecha musume]] instead of the series' trademark [[steampunk]] [[mecha]].

The game launched on December 12, 2020 and ended service on June 30, 2021. [[Hololive]]'s [[Houshou Marine]] and [[Shirakami Fubuki]] were slated to do [[voice actor|voice]] work for new original characters, but the collaboration was canceled due to the game's premature closure.

title: weissritter
body:
A development of the [[Gespenst MK II]], the Weiss Ritter is a high-speed aerial mecha possessing high firepower for its size and speed. It's main weapon is the Oxtongue rifle, able to switch between energy based projectiles and solid round munitions.  It also bears the Gespenst derived three barreled beam cannon on the left arm, as well as the split missile backpack.

It is piloted by [[Excellen Browning]].

title: ling_xiaoyu
body:
A character from the [[Tekken]] series of fighting games. Introduced in [[Tekken 3]]. Has a crush on series main character [[Kazama Jin]]. Often followed by her pet [[panda|panda bear]], [[Panda (Tekken)|Panda]]. 

She is often referred to as Xiao by her classmates, including Jin and [[Hirano Miharu|Miharu]].

title: subarashiki_kono_sekai
body:
An action role-playing game developed by [[Square Enix]]'s [[Kingdom Hearts]] team for the [[Nintendo DS]]. Set in the modern-day Shibuya shopping district of Tokyo, the game features a distinctive art style inspired by Shibuya and its youth culture.

Known as [b]The World Ends with You[/b] in English regions.

h4. See also

* [[Shin Subarashiki Kono Sekai]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: The World Ends With You":http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_World_Ends_with_You
other_names: すばらしきこのせかい
